intro: Mammillaria umbrina, commonly known as the shaded mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and a covering of white to grayish spines. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, appearing in late spring or early summer. Due to its slow growth and unique appearance, it is a popular choice for collectors and succulent enthusiasts.
